intro: Haplophyllum ermenekense, commonly known as the Ermenek rockrose, is a perennial shrub native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant typically features small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers during the summer months. Haplophyllum ermenekense is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
